adjectives.description: boldfaced (comparative more boldfaced, superlative most boldfaced)

examples: He had the bold-faced effrontery to ask for a raise.

entries.meaning: (typography) Of text emphasized by being set in a font having thicker strokes, yielding a heavier or darker appearance.
simple past tense and past participle of boldface (to print or write in a bold manner)
examples: He boldfaced the quote so it would stand out even though I told him it looked ugly.
